translated: the one with eyes went to the forest;
Taking a spade and a basket,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the path.
there was a single Lord of the People;
the leader, the lord of men.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā maggadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā maggadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the venerable Maggadāyaka recited these verses.
The Elder Maggadāyaka’s Story is the seventh.
